frame.name: Transition_to_a_quality
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> ends up with a particular new <fen>Final_quality</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Entity">The milk</fex> has <t>gone</t> <fex name="Final_quality">sour</fex> <fex name="Time">already</fex> .</ex>
There is only one lexical unit, go.v, that evokes this frame directly in English, and it combines only with a limited set of <fen>Final_quality</fen> types, such as undesirability (bad, sour), insanity (crazy), inability (limp), or posture (prone). However, the frame itself is intended to cover situations with arbitrary <fen>Final_quality</fen> types. As such, frames describing simple state change should inherit from this frame, incorporating the <fen>Final_quality</fen> FE as part of the background meaning of the frame.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>Where the change takes place.
<ex>I <t>went</t> nuts <fex name="Final_quality">in Berlin</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>When the change occurs.
<ex><fex name="tim">By 1945</fex> he had <t>gone</t> bad .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration_of_final_state
FE.definition:
<def-root>The length of time that the <fen>Entity</fen> retains the <fen>Final_quality</fen>.
<ex>He <t>went</t> nuts <fex name="dur">for three years</fex> . </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (<ment>probably, presumably, mysteriously</ment>), secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In cases where the <fen>Entity</fen> is intentional, <fen>Manner</fen> may indicate salient characteristics of an intentional <fen>Entity</fen> that also affect the event (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>).
<ex>The majority <fex name="man">slowly</fex> <t>went</t> silent .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Entity</fen> which undergoes a change so that it possesses the <fen>Final_quality</fen>.
<ex><fex name="ent">I</fex> <t>went</t> limp .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Final_quality
FE.definition:
<def-root>The quality that the <fen>Entity</fen> has at the end of the event.
<ex>Everything 's <t>going</t> <fex name="finq">wrong</fex>!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Transitional_period
FE.definition:
<def-root>The period during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in transition.
<ex><fex name="trp">Over the last 5 years</fex>, I've <t>gone</t> crazy.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE marks the set of conditions under which the <fen>Entity</fen> adopts <fen>Final_quality</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Group
FE.definition: <def-root>A characterization of the kind of <fen>Group</fen> members that the <fen>Entity</fen> pertains to, and which are saliently affected by its change.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any eventuality or entity which brings about the change of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>Smithers <t>went</t> numb <fex name="Explanation">from all the work he'd been doing</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: go.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pass into or be in a specified state, especially an undesirable one:
